result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael P Beets in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS  14CT262, 14TR2361 & 15CM173

Plea agreement; Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 OWI 3rd  in 14CT262.  Counts 2 & 3 DRI.  15CM173 count 1  DRI. 
The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. Factual basis found.
14TR2361   Dismissed.

Argument by Defense

Defendant Michael P Beets in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Both above set for plea and sentence hearings 7/24/15 at 1:30 for 1/2 hr.
Bond(s) to continue in their present form.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael P Beets in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM173 & 14CT262.........

JURY TRIAL TO CONTINUE,  15CM173 TO TRACK

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages.  
Must have no contact with Frank M. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

$1000.00 cash bond previously posted.

05/13/2015 BOND MODIFIED TO DELETE THE CONDITION OF "NO CONTACT WITH FRANK M."  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF PREVIOUS BOND ORDERED, TO REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Michael P Beets in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense moves to delete the no contact provision of bond. Court grants. All other conditions remain in full force and effect.
